Pharah

Fareeha Amari's commitment to duty runs in her blood. She comes from a long line of highly decorated soldiers and burns with the desire to serve with honor.

Damage

Giza, Egypt (formerly), Watchpoint: Gibraltar

Apr 15 (Age: 34)

Abilities

Rocket LauncherJet DashJump JetConcussive BlastBarrageHover Jets

Rocket Launcher

Long-range explosive projectile weapon.

Jet Dash

Boost horizontally.

Jump Jet

Fly rapidly upwards. Grants some fuel.

Concussive Blast

Launch an explosive blast to knock back enemies.

Barrage

Hover in place and launch a continuous volley of mini-rockets.

Hover Jets

Hold to hover. Slows falling when fuel is empty. Fuel only regenerates while on the ground.

Keys displayed are defaults for PC. They are configurable in game.

Stadium Powers

Stadium Powers are ability-changing upgrades obtainable in the Armory. Each hero has 12 unique Powers to choose from.

Evasive Maneuvers

After using Jump Jet, Concussive Blast gains homing and hinders enemies for 150%s on direct hit.

Carpet Bomb

Gain 40% Move Speed during Barrage.
Barrage has 50% increased duration.

Cyclic Salvo

Rocket Launcher direct hits grant 10 fuel and reduce your cooldowns by 1s.

Blitz Barrage

Gain 40% Move Speed during Barrage.
After using Jet Dash, fire a Barrage with 75% fewer Mini-Rockets.

Fuel Depot

Rocket Launcher direct hits permanently increase your maximum fuel by 2, stacking up to 25 times.

Fuel Conversion

Jet Dash gains 50% cooldown reduction but now costs 65 fuel.

Heat Seekers

After using Jet Dash, your next Primary Fire locks onto enemies.

Launch Vector

Whenever you knockback an enemy with Concussive Blast, fire 3 homing Mini-Rockets at them.

Speed Kills

Dealing Weapon Damage grants 5% Move Speed and 3% Attack Speed for 3s, stacking up to 6 times. Direct hits grant double stacks.

Triple Volley

After using an ability, your next Primary Fire fires 3 rockets that each deal 40% damage.

Recursion Battery

Mini-Rockets gain 25% Ability Lifesteal.

Extra Charge

Concussive Blast gains 1 extra charge.

More on Stadium

Story

Fareeha Amari dreamed of being part of Overwatch with her mother Ana, only to see it disbanded before she had the chance. She found success as “Pharah”, head of an elite security squad guarding the rogue AI that started the Omnic Crisis. But now that a new Overwatch has returned, Pharah's dreams are finally becoming a reality.

View ComicEARLY LIFE

As a child, Fareeha dreamed of following in her mother's footsteps and joining the global peacekeeping force, Overwatch. Her mother, Ana Amari, was second in command of the organization, though she desired a different life for her daughter, one free from fighting. Still, Fareeha enlisted in the Egyptian army, and her dogged persistence and tactical prowess caused her to rise up through the officer ranks. She was a courageous leader and earned the loyalty of all who served under her. With her exemplary record, Fareeha was well placed to join the ranks of Overwatch, but before she had that opportunity, her mother was killed in the line of duty, and Overwatch was disbanded soon after.

HELIX

After leaving the army with a commendation for distinguished service, Fareeha was offered employment with Helix Security International, a private security firm contracted to defend the artificial intelligence research facility beneath the Giza Plateau. The top-secret facility was touted as vital to the safety of not only the region but countries across the globe, as it housed the remains of the rogue god program Anubis. Fareeha gladly accepted the choice assignment and received training in the Raptora Mark VI, an experimental combat suit designed for rapid mobility and devastating firepower. Under the call sign "Pharah," she worked to safeguard the AI installation. Years after her mother’s death, Fareeha was shocked to receive a letter from Ana, stating that she was alive, but unable to return to her. Fareeha was confused, angry, and disappointed; Ana’s pattern of choosing her mission over her daughter had damaged Fareeha’s trust in her. Fareeha had grieved her mother’s death once, and this felt like losing her again. Over time, she came more to terms with Ana’s decision. Despite her lingering hurt, Fareeha had her mission, and Ana had hers.

RECALL

Fareeha had also let go of her childhood dreams of joining Overwatch, proud of what she had built with Helix. She turned down multiple requests from Tracer, Brigitte, and Reinhardt to answer Winston’s Recall. It was only when Cole Cassidy arrived in Cairo that she seriously considered joining. Cassidy brought Ana and Fareeha together in an emotional reunion that both reopened and healed many old wounds. When Cassidy called on Pharah to back up the nascent Overwatch on a mission to counter Null Sector in Busan, she answered the call. Now the Helix hero has expanded her horizons, lending her impressive skillset to rebuild the peacekeeping agency she once idolized.
